Know Your Innovative Self

The Berkeley Innovation Index (BII) is an open research project created at the Sutardja Center for Entrepeneurship & technology (SCET) at UC Berkeley. In cooperation with industry professionals, BII has been developed to offer simple yet powerful ways to measure something never before measurable: An individual's innovative mindset level, by relating it to seven traits linked to individual innovation capability.
MORE ABOUT SCET LEARN ABOUT BII
Individual Innovation Mindset Report 
 
Your Personal Innovation Mindset Level is Currently  OUT OF 10. 
The following factors are components of your innovation mindset: 
TRUST:   OUT OF 10.   This is a meassure of your ability to trust others (belief in self).  Trust is essential for alignment, transparency, and a healthy working culture.   A high trust score enables you to function within teams without friction, and adapt well in times of high pressure. 
RESILIENCE:  OUT OF 10.   Resilience is a measure of your tolerance to failure and ability to recover after encountering obstacles.  Resilience empowers teams to assume risk and try new approaches.  A high score is correlated with agility and adaptivity. 
DIVERSITY:   OUT OF 10.   Diversity measures openness to different perspectives, variation in professional networks, and perceived diversity in a team or workgroup.  Diversity superimposes knowledge and experience with different perspectives.  A high score is essential for networking with external partners and onboarding talent. 
BELIEF:   OUT OF 10.    This is a measure of your belief in your strengths and ability to achieve the goals you set for yourself.   A high score indicates that you are convinced that you and your team can carry out almost any task. 
COLLABORATION:   OUT OF 10.   Collaboration measures ability to function within teams, communicate across departments, and evaluate the quality of external partnerships.  A high score suggests that you possess a collective feeling of responsibility and strong alignment to reach mutually-set goals. 
PERFECTION:   OUT OF 10.   Resource Awareness (belief in others) quantifies your ability to allocate resources efficiently and adequately.   No product or solution will ever be perfect, but the best balance constraint is found when something is “good enough."   A high score suggests you not only trust your teammatex, but can also strike the right balance in the execution and assignment of tasks and responsibilities. 
INNOVATION ZONE:   OUT OF 10.   This measures your ability to implement innovation strategies and ideate new solutions for products and services.   High scores reflect aptitude(s) in gaining a competitive edge, and the ingenuity to associate established brand and products with innovative/groundbreaking technologies. 
 
This is not a fixed level, anyone can grow their innovation mindset. 

Your level has been estimated using an analysis based on the Berkeley Method for Entreprenuership & Innovation, the Comfort Zone Scale, and fundamental testing methods in the field of Social Psychology.

RECOMMENDATIONS:  
 
 
 
 
  It is hard to improve upon what can't be measured.
The Berkeley Innovation Index (BII) is a set of online assessments designed to enable people, workgroups, and organizations to measure their attitudes, beliefs and behaviors -- in order to learn how they are correlated with those of successful entrepreneurs and innovators. These assessments are designed to help people, and firms, understand their current capacity for innovation, to diagnose their innovation challenges, and to enable the development of an innovation mindset.

If your team needs comprehensive attention, we are always looking for new collaborators. Moreover, BII can be tailored to the specific needs of your firm. We measure, quantify, report, and counsel you through your improvement process.
TEAMS + CONSULTING + COLLABORATION
